subject: Psychology
title: Why People Help
description: Learn Why People Help in one minute.

hook.text: A stranger jumps onto subway tracks to save a fallen man. Why risk your life for someone you've never met?

buildup.text: Prosocial behavior is any action intended to benefit others â€” from holding doors to donating organs.

discovery.text: Theories include empathy-altruism (we help because we feel for others) and egoism (we help to feel good ourselves).

twist.text: Even if helping is partly selfish, the outcome is the same: someone benefits. Motive matters less than effect.

climax.text: Whether pure altruism exists is philosophy's question. That humans help constantly is psychology's finding.

punchline.text: Why we help matters less than the fact that we do.

quiz.question: What does the empathy-altruism hypothesis propose?
options: We help others because we feel empathy for them
All helping behavior is purely selfish
Humans never help without being asked
